title: Ticket #3768: condor_status -autoformat doesn't play well with hostname
description:
Observed behavior (this is in the UW CS pool and should be easy to reproduce there): 
% condor_status -format '%s\n' Machine puffin.cs.wisc.edu
puffin.cs.wisc.edu
puffin.cs.wisc.edu
puffin.cs.wisc.edu
puffin.cs.wisc.edu
% condor_status -af Machine puffin.cs.wisc.edu
achernar.cs.wisc.edu undefined
achernar.cs.wisc.edu undefined
achernar.cs.wisc.edu undefined
achernar.cs.wisc.edu undefined
acrux.cs.wisc.edu undefined
acrux.cs.wisc.edu undefined
[1000+ lines deleted]
zeus07.stat.wisc.edu undefined
zeus08.stat.wisc.edu undefined
zeus08.stat.wisc.edu undefined
zeus08.stat.wisc.edu undefined
zeus08.stat.wisc.edu undefined

Expected behavior: output from both commands is identical.

It appears that when using -af or -autoformat, a filter based on hostname is ignored.
remarks:
2013-Jul-11 15:23:34 by johnkn:
This is not a bug. -af doesn't consume a single argument, it consumes all arguments until the next -

what you want is 

condor_status puffin.cs.wisc.edu -af Machine
instead.

It is a usability issue though. condor_q will recognize a bare - as terminating the -af argument list. I'll add the same capability to condor_status.
